intro: Micranthes nelsoniana subsp. aestivalis, commonly known as the spring starflower, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The subspecies aestivalis is distinguished by its earlier blooming time compared to other subspecies of Micranthes.
